headline: Better AI Chip Stock: Nvidia vs. Broadcom
summary: When it comes to designing semiconductor chips used to power artificial intelligence (AI) workloads, two companies stand head and shoulders above the rest: Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA) and Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO).  Nvidia has been the biggest early winner in AI chips, but Broadcom has been gaining momentum.  Nvidia and Broadcom are taking two very different approaches to the AI chip market.

headline: Why Broadcom Stock Is Tumbling Today
summary: Shares of Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), a semiconductor designer, are falling Monday as investors grow increasingly concerned about President Donald Trump's tariffs and economic decisions.  On Monday, Trump again called on Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell to lower interest rates.  The Fed operates independently from the White House and the rest of the federal government, but Trump has ratcheted up his expressions of displeasure with Powell, and presidential aides are reportedly looking for ways that the administration might be able to fire Powell legally before his term as chairman is up in 2026.

headline: Nvidia stock falls as China's Huawei reportedly boosts AI chip production after Trump's export ban
summary: Nvidia and other chip stocks fell Monday as China's Huawei is reportedly boosting production of its leading AI chips following Trump's new export rules announced last week.

headline: If the Stock Market Continues Sinking, Here's How I'd Invest My Next $500
summary: The stock market is having a rough start to the year.  The S&P 500 is down about 15% from its recent peak.  Topping that list are NextEra Energy (NYSE: NEE), Broadcom (NASDAQ: AVGO), and Invitation Homes (NYSE: INVH).
